cip.render.util3d

Class Plane3fIntersection

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.util3d.Plane3fIntersection

  • public final class Plane3fIntersection
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a the intersection of a ray with a plane in 3D of single precision (the components are represented by float values), hence the name Plane3fIntersection. This object can be used as both a typical object instantiated using the new and reclaimed by the garbage collector when the are no longer references to the object, and/or a cached object which is borrowed from a dynamically growing cache of Plane3f objects.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GOING_INTO
      The origin of the ray is outside of (a positive distance from) the plane, and the intersection is for the ray going into the plane.
      static int GOING_OUT_OF
      The origin of the ray is inside of (a negative distance from) the plane, and the intersection is for the ray going out of the plane.
      float m_fDist
      The distance to the intersection from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF.
      int m_nCode
      The code describing the type of intersection.
      Plane3fIntersection m_next 
      Plane3f m_plane
      The plane being intersected - this is always a reference and the plane is not owned by this intersection.
      static int NONE_INSIDE
      This means that the ray is essentially parallel to the plane and the origin of the ray is on the inside of (a negative distance from) the plane.
      static int NONE_OUTSIDE
      The code for no intersection with the plane and the ray being outside the plane.

    • Field Detail

      • NONE_OUTSIDE

        public static final int NONE_OUTSIDE
        The code for no intersection with the plane and the ray being outside the plane. This means that the ray is essentially parallel to the plane and the origin of the ray is on the outside of (a positive distance from) the plane. Essentially parallel means that the intersection distance is essentially infinite (within floating point tolerances) and, therefore, meaningless.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NONE_INSIDE

        public static final int NONE_INSIDE
        This means that the ray is essentially parallel to the plane and the origin of the ray is on the inside of (a negative distance from) the plane. Essentially parallel means that the intersection distance is essentially infinite (within floating point tolerances) and, therefore, meaningless.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GOING_INTO

        public static final int GOING_INTO
        The origin of the ray is outside of (a positive distance from) the plane, and the intersection is for the ray going into the plane.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GOING_OUT_OF

        public static final int GOING_OUT_OF
        The origin of the ray is inside of (a negative distance from) the plane, and the intersection is for the ray going out of the plane.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_next

        public Plane3fIntersection m_next

      • m_fDist

        public float m_fDist
        The distance to the intersection from the origin of the ray if the code is GOING_INTO or GOING_OUT_OF. Otherwise, this field is meaningless. NOTE: if the distance is negative, it means the intersection is effectively behind the start of the ray.

      • m_nCode

        public int m_nCode
        The code describing the type of intersection.

      • m_plane

        public Plane3f m_plane
        The plane being intersected - this is always a reference and the plane is not owned by this intersection.
